pullrequest.title: Part 4: DARTDoublePendulum, PID control using dart (rebranched)

content.raw:
comment from @JChoclin:

Looks great. Everything is ok and works as expected. Here is the evolution of the error in the test.

![plot](https://bitbucket-assetroot.s3.amazonaws.com/repository/5q9rMzd/303082070-image.png?Signature=R4c8%2FXsiHAh8lfqHr%2F%2FzaVsYEfw%3D&Expires=1521829473&AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAIQWXW6WLXMB5QZAQ&versionId=4tTRy_0XWBCgKbEt_h2DXpvx_SwtXMmk)

Can I recommend to add some comments to explain what is going on with the abstract interface that is being implemented? I think that some comments highlighting the usage of Composite and Specify data would be nice. Maybe add some comments in ForwardStep.hh or maybe add the comments in the test when input and output classes are used.

I would add some explanation to DARTDoublePendulum.cc or DARTDoublePendulum.hh explaining why we decided to include these files too, adding some class comments. Maybe we should add a readme explaining the different examples. Something to document this example.

Also, code-check shows many warnings, but those are not related to this PR.
content.html:
comment from @JChoclin:

Looks great. Everything is ok and works as expected. Here is the evolution of the error in the test.

Can I recommend to add some comments to explain what is going on with the abstract interface that is being implemented? I think that some comments highlighting the usage of Composite and Specify data would be nice. Maybe add some comments in ForwardStep.hh or maybe add the comments in the test when input and output classes are used.

I would add some explanation to DARTDoublePendulum.cc or DARTDoublePendulum.hh explaining why we decided to include these files too, adding some class comments. Maybe we should add a readme explaining the different examples. Something to document this example.

Also, code-check shows many warnings, but those are not related to this PR.

content.raw: @mxgrey mentioned that it's better to use namespaces instead of prefixes (like `ignition::physics::dart::DoublePendulum` instead of `ignition::physics::DARTDoublePendulum`). I guess we should move them to subfolders as well
content.html: @mxgrey mentioned that it's better to use namespaces instead of prefixes (like ignition::physics::dart::DoublePendulum instead of ignition::physics::DARTDoublePendulum). I guess we should move them to subfolders as well

pullrequest.title: Part 4: DARTDoublePendulum, PID control using dart (rebranched)

content.raw: The homebrew build is failing to link to console_bridge (used by urdfdom, which is used by dart),  in a similar failure to https://github.com/dartsim/dart/issues/1200. I believe it will be fixed by https://github.com/ros/console_bridge/pull/60 but in the meantime I will make a workaround.
content.html: The homebrew build is failing to link to console_bridge (used by urdfdom, which is used by dart), in a similar failure to https://github.com/dartsim/dart/issues/1200. I believe it will be fixed by https://github.com/ros/console_bridge/pull/60 but in the meantime I will make a workaround.

pullrequest.title: Part 4: DARTDoublePendulum, PID control using dart (rebranched)
Part 4: DARTDoublePendulum, PID control using dart (rebranched)

content.raw: @mxgrey should I put the `rrbot.xml` file (really a `urdf`) into a `resources` folder like in your mesh pull request?
content.html: @mxgrey should I put the rrbot.xml file (really a urdf) into a resources folder like in your mesh pull request?

pullrequest.title: Part 4: DARTDoublePendulum, PID control using dart (rebranched)

content.raw:
Good question. I don't have any strong opinion on it, but being consistent would probably be a good idea. If you prefer a `resources` folder then go ahead and move it there. If you prefer a `data` folder in `test`, then let me know and I can change the `MeshShape` PR to match.

I'd probably lean more towards a `resources` folder in the root, because the items we put in there might be useful for more than just testing, plus it makes it easier to have an `IGNITION_PHYSICS_RESOURCE_DIR` variable that can be used by all project components.
content.html:
Good question. I don't have any strong opinion on it, but being consistent would probably be a good idea. If you prefer a resources folder then go ahead and move it there. If you prefer a data folder in test, then let me know and I can change the MeshShape PR to match.

I'd probably lean more towards a resources folder in the root, because the items we put in there might be useful for more than just testing, plus it makes it easier to have an IGNITION_PHYSICS_RESOURCE_DIR variable that can be used by all project components.

pullrequest.title: Part 4: DARTDoublePendulum, PID control using dart (rebranched)

content.raw: ok, I just moved `rrbot.xml` to a `resources` folder in the root
content.html: ok, I just moved rrbot.xml to a resources folder in the root

this is ready for review, with the caveat that the `SetState` functionality hasn't yet been ported to the new API, so much of that code is commented out. I will revisit it in January.

the bullet pull request #16 is ready as well

pullrequest.title: Part 4: DARTDoublePendulum, PID control using dart (rebranched)

content.raw:
Just a remark: printing this to `stderr` makes the printout red in my IDE, which makes me do a double-take since my automatic is that the test failed when I see that.

We might want to print this to `stdout` instead, if only so that it buffers in sync with the rest of the `stdout` test output.

Also, lines 46 and 47 seem redundant since they both just print the `name` variable. I’m guessing there’s some debugging cruft here.
content.html:
Just a remark: printing this to stderr makes the printout red in my IDE, which makes me do a double-take since my automatic is that the test failed when I see that.

We might want to print this to stdout instead, if only so that it buffers in sync with the rest of the stdout test output.

Also, lines 46 and 47 seem redundant since they both just print the name variable. I’m guessing there’s some debugging cruft here.

pullrequest.title: Part 4: DARTDoublePendulum, PID control using dart (rebranched)

content.raw: Just a note: Some time after merging in these PRs, I'd like to revisit the `ForwardStep.hh` header to clean up the input/output data structures for the forward stepping function. The data structures that are currently in there were only meant as scaffolding. In particular, `Point` and `FreeVector` should probably be replaced by `RelativePosition3d` and `RelativeForce3d`.
content.html: Just a note: Some time after merging in these PRs, I'd like to revisit the ForwardStep.hh header to clean up the input/output data structures for the forward stepping function. The data structures that are currently in there were only meant as scaffolding. In particular, Point and FreeVector should probably be replaced by RelativePosition3d and RelativeForce3d.
